graph.original_query: Create a professional one-page (index.html) dark-themed (Black and White only) portfolio website for a Software Hacker using Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css (for scroll-in section reveals and CTA hover transitions), and Splide.js (for a testimonial carousel and horizontally scrolling image gallery); use CDN only (no build tools); apply a sleek black/charcoal base, warm beige/muted orange accents, elegant typography, refined spacing, subtle transitions (no glows/neons); include sticky header with anchor links, hero section with fullscreen image (https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1), category highlight cards (https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1), animated counters (clients, projects, years), About (mission, timeline), Gallery or Services grid (6–8 projects), Contact form (name/email/message), and footer with social icons; keep layout responsive and professional, with no lorem ipsum, real readable text, and pure HTML/CSS/JS; Use CoderAgent in 9–10 precise updates (meta, header, hero, counters, cards, timeline, gallery, testimonial slider, contact form, layout cleanup), and finally audit spacing, contrast, and visual balance to ensure premium Software Hacker look. Ask the CoderAgent to update the same index.html, use code to update it if file is longer and make sure old content is not deleted, and only required sections are updated. Remind CoderAgent to update (not overwrite it)

T001.initial_thoughts: Let me think through this. I need to create an HTML file with the specified meta tags, title, and CDN links. The CSS should set the background to black, text to white, and font family to sans-serif. I will use direct file creation since it is a straightforward HTML file generation task.

files.index.html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>Software Hacker Portfolio</title>
    <link href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/tailwindcss@3.4.1/tailwind.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/animate.css/4.1.1/animate.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/splidejs/4.1.4/css/splide.min.css" rel="stylesheet">
    <link href="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/flowbite/2.3.0/flowbite.min.css" rel="stylesheet" />
    <style>
        body {
            background-color: black;
            color: white;
            font-family: sans-serif;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/flowbite/2.3.0/flowbite.min.js"></script>
    <script src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/splidejs/4.1.4/js/splide.min.js"></script>
</body>
</html>

nodes.description: Create the basic HTML structure for the one-page portfolio website, including meta tags, title, and CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js. Also, create the basic CSS for dark theme in the style tag.
nodes.agent_prompt: Create the basic HTML structure for a one-page portfolio website. Include meta tags for viewport settings and character set. Set the title to "Software Hacker Portfolio". Add CDN links for Tailwind CSS, Flowbite, Animate.css, and Splide.js in the head section. In the style tag, add CSS to set the background to black, text to white, and font family to sans-serif as the default styles for the dark theme. Do not add any content in the body, just the basic structure. Save the output to index.html file. Do not generate any external CSS or JS files.

<!DOCTYPE html>

nodes.description: Implement the sticky header with anchor links to different sections (Hero, About, Gallery, Contact).
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a sticky header at the top of the page. The header should contain anchor links to the Hero, About, Gallery, and Contact sections. Style the header with Tailwind CSS classes to make it fixed, full-width, black background with 50% opacity, white text, and add padding. Ensure the anchor links are properly styled and point to the correct sections of the page, using Tailwind CSS. Add a subtle hover effect on the links. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the header section. Ensure to use correct HTML, valid CSS, and proper Tailwind CSS classes.

nodes.description: Create the Hero section with a full-screen image from the provided URL, headline, and a brief introduction.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a Hero section below the header. The Hero section should contain a full-screen image from the URL 'https://picsum.photos/1600/900?blur=1'. Add a headline "Software Hacker" and a brief introduction about the hacker's skills and experience. Use Tailwind CSS classes to style the section with a black background, white text, center alignment, padding, and full-screen height. Ensure the image is responsive and covers the entire section. Also, add a subtle animation effect to the headline and introduction text using Animate.css classes when the section is scrolled into view. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the Hero section. Use valid HTML and CSS, and ensure the Hero section is visually appealing and engaging.

nodes.description: Implement animated counters for Clients, Projects, and Years of Experience.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a section for animated counters below the Hero section. Include counters for Clients, Projects, and Years of Experience. Use HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to create the animated counters. Use Tailwind CSS classes for styling the counters, such as setting the font size, color, and alignment. Use a JavaScript library like CountUp.js or a similar library to animate the counters. Each counter should have a label and a value. The values should be dynamically updated when the section is scrolled into view. Use Animate.css for scroll in effect. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the animated counters section. Ensure the counters are visually appealing and responsive.

nodes.description: Add category highlight cards using images from the provided URL.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a section for category highlight cards below the animated counters. Create 3-4 cards highlighting different categories such as Web Development, Mobile Development, and Cloud Computing. Use images from the URL 'https://picsum.photos/400/600?grayscale/random=1' for each card. Each card should contain an image, a title, and a brief description. Use Tailwind CSS classes to style the cards with a black background, white text, rounded corners, and a shadow effect. Ensure the cards are responsive and visually appealing. Add hover effect to the cards using Animate.css. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the category highlight cards section.

nodes.description: Create the About section with a mission statement and a timeline of key achievements.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add an About section below the category highlight cards. Include a mission statement and a timeline of key achievements. Use HTML to structure the content and Tailwind CSS to style the section with a black background, white text, padding, and a visually appealing layout. The timeline should showcase the hacker's key achievements in chronological order. Use CSS to style the timeline with lines, circles, and labels. The mission statement should be concise and reflect the hacker's goals and values. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the About section. Ensure the section is responsive and provides valuable information about the hacker.

output.error: Insertion point not found in index.html

nodes.description: Implement the Gallery or Services grid with 6-8 projects.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a Gallery or Services grid below the About section. Include 6-8 projects or services with images and descriptions. Use HTML to structure the grid and Tailwind CSS to style it with a black background, white text, padding, and a responsive layout. Use placeholder images from a service like Picsum Photos or Unsplash. Each project or service should have an image, a title, and a brief description. Add a hover effect on the projects using Animate.css. Ensure the grid is visually appealing and showcases the hacker's skills and experience. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the Gallery or Services grid section.

nodes.description: Add a testimonial slider using Splide.js.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a testimonial slider below the Gallery or Services grid. Use Splide.js to create the slider. Include at least 3 testimonials with quotes and author names. Style the slider with Tailwind CSS classes for the dark theme (black background, white text, etc.). Ensure the slider is responsive and visually appealing. Initialize Splide.js with appropriate options for autoplay, looping, and navigation. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the testimonial slider section. Use valid HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to implement the slider.

nodes.description: Create a contact form with name, email, and message fields.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a contact form below the testimonial slider. Include fields for name, email, and message. Use HTML to create the form and Tailwind CSS to style it with a black background, white text, padding, and a responsive layout. Add labels and placeholders to the form fields. Style the form elements (inputs, textarea, and button) to match the dark theme. The form should be functional, but no server-side validation or submission is required. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the contact form section. Add relevant Animate.css effects. Use valid HTML and CSS to create the form.

nodes.description: Implement the footer with social icons and a copyright notice.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file to add a footer at the bottom of the page. Include social icons for platforms like GitHub, Twitter, and LinkedIn. Use HTML to structure the footer and Tailwind CSS to style it with a black background, white text, padding, and a responsive layout. Add a copyright notice with the current year. Link the social icons to the appropriate profiles. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update/add the footer section. Use valid HTML and CSS to create the footer.

nodes.description: Perform final layout cleanup, spacing adjustments, contrast checks, and visual balance to ensure a premium look.
nodes.agent_prompt: Update the `index.html` file with comprehensive CSS refinements. Scrutinize spacing, contrast, and visual balance across all sections to solidify a premium software hacker aesthetic. Fine-tune Tailwind CSS classes to unify typography, correct padding/margins, and optimize contrast within the established dark theme. Ensure responsive behavior on diverse devices through meticulous breakpoint adjustments. Carefully audit all transitions and animations from Animate.css to maintain subtlety and professionalism, avoiding jarring or excessive effects. Apply micro-adjustments to splide testimonial sliders to guarantee correct alignment. The final result should manifest a cohesive, polished, and visually refined presentation consistent with elite design standards. Ensure all coding is valid HTML/CSS. Do not overwrite the existing code in `index.html`, only update the necessary sections for visual improvement and code validity. Aim for pixel perfection.

nodes.description: Summarize the resulting code for index.html, check if its valid and semantic.
nodes.agent_prompt: Summarize the HTML code of the `index.html` file. Check if the HTML has semantic tags and is valid HTML.
